newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgarian inflation quickens to 26.9 pct in Dec.
newsitem.headline: Bulgarian inflation quickens to 26.9 pct in Dec.

text.p: Bulgaria's monthly consumer price inflation quickened to 26.9 percent in December from 9.7 percent in November, state radio said, quoting the National Statistics Institute (NSI).
BULGARIAN CONSUMER PRICES DEC NOV DEC'95
Inflation surged because of large prices rises in bread, meat, fuels, electricity, clothes and other basic goods in December, the radio said.
Breakdown figures were not immediately available.
The rapid depreciation of the lev against the dollar was also a major reason for higher inflation because it boosted prices of fuels and energy, the radio said.
The lev fell to 500 per dollar at the end of December from around 360 at the beginning of the month. It traded near 650 on the local interbank market on Thursday.
Fuel prices rose by 9-10 percent at the beginning of last month and by further 21-26 percent two weeks later.
Cumulative inflation for this year was seen at minimum 150 percent with more than 60 percent in the first quarter alone, the radio said. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 981 8569; 981 4145
